name: South Korea
description: South Korea, officially the Republic of Korea, is a country on the Korean Peninsula in East Asia. It’s a nation of dramatic contrasts, blending ancient traditions with cutting-edge technology. From the bustling metropolis of Seoul to the serene beauty of Jeju Island and the rugged mountains of Jirisan National Park, South Korea offers a diverse range of landscapes, cultures, and experiences.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: South Korea boasts a high population density, with most people residing in urban areas.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is approximately 85 people per square kilometer.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Seoul is the vibrant capital and largest city, a global center for finance, technology, and culture.
quickFacts.detail: Seoul is one of the world's most populous metropolitan areas.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: South Korea's land area is relatively small, but incredibly diverse.
quickFacts.detail: It's roughly the size of Indiana, USA.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of South Korea.
quickFacts.detail: As of November 2023, 1 USD is approximately 1,300 KRW.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Korean is the primary language spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Hangul, the Korean alphabet, is remarkably logical and easy to learn.

climateData.title: Climate of South Korea
climateData.description: South Korea experiences a humid continental climate with four distinct seasons. Summers are hot and humid, winters are cold and snowy, and spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures and vibrant foliage.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring in South Korea is a breathtaking spectacle of blooming cherry blossoms and azaleas. The weather is mild and pleasant, making it ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are hot and humid, with frequent rainfall. However, the beaches along the coast offer a welcome escape.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn is arguably the most beautiful season in South Korea, with vibrant fall foliage painting the mountainsides in shades of red, orange, and yellow.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are cold and snowy, particularly in the mountainous regions. Skiing and snowboarding are popular winter activities.

naturalWonders.name: Jeju Island
naturalWonders.description: Jeju Island, a volcanic island off the southern coast, is a UNESCO World Heritage site renowned for its unique geological formations, diverse ecosystems, and stunning beaches. It’s a popular destination for both domestic and international tourists.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island’s volcanic origins have created a landscape of dramatic cliffs, lava tubes, and lush forests. Hallasan Mountain, the highest peak in South Korea, dominates the island’s interior.
viewingTips: Check the weather forecast before heading out.

naturalWonders.name: Jirisan National Park
naturalWonders.description: Jirisan National Park, spanning three provinces, is South Korea’s largest national park and a haven for biodiversity. It’s a popular destination for hiking and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s diverse ecosystems range from subtropical forests to alpine meadows. It’s home to a wide variety of flora and fauna, including endangered species.
viewingTips: Bring plenty of water and snacks.

naturalWonders.name: Seoraksan National Park
naturalWonders.description: Seoraksan National Park is famed for its dramatic granite peaks, ancient temples, and vibrant autumn foliage. It’s a challenging but rewarding destination for experienced hikers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s rugged terrain and stunning vistas offer unparalleled views of the Korean peninsula. Numerous temples are nestled within the park’s forested slopes.

biodiversityCategory.name: Korean Fauna
biodiversityCategory.description: South Korea is home to a diverse range of animal species, including several endemic and endangered species. The country’s varied habitats support a rich tapestry of wildlife.

statistics.details: Includes red pandas, tigers, and various deer species.
South Korea is a major migratory route for birds, attracting a wide variety of species.
Diverse reptile and amphibian populations thrive in South Korea’s wetlands and forests.

notableSpecies.name: Red Panda
notableSpecies.significance: One of the few remaining populations of red pandas outside of China.

notableSpecies.name: Korean Tiger
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of South Korea’s conservation efforts.

notableSpecies.name: White-browed Reed Warbler
notableSpecies.significance: A key migratory bird species that relies on South Korea’s wetlands.

ecosystemData.title: Korean Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: South Korea’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from subtropical forests to alpine meadows and coastal wetlands. These ecosystems play a vital role in maintaining biodiversity and providing essential ecosystem services.

biodiversityCategories.name: Korean Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: South Korea boasts a rich flora, including numerous endemic plant species.

statistics.details: Unique plant species found only in South Korea.

biodiversityCategories.name: Korean Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: South Korea’s wetlands are crucial for biodiversity and flood control.

statistics.details: Includes tidal flats, salt marshes, and freshwater marshes.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in South Korea
activities.description: South Korea offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and camping to water sports and cultural experiences.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore South Korea’s stunning mountains and trails.

activities.name: Hallasan Hike
activities.description: A challenging but rewarding hike to the summit of South Korea’s highest mountain.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water, snacks, appropriate clothing.

activities.name: Jeju Olle Trails
activities.duration: Variable (sections can be completed in a few hours)
activities.description: A network of scenic trails that circle Jeju Island.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the beaches and coastal waters of South Korea.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Catch some waves at popular surfing spots along the coast.
activities.requirements: Surfboard, wetsuit (depending on water temperature), swimming skills.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline and rivers by kayak.

clothing.winter: Warm coat, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots
clothing.yearRound: Layers of clothing, comfortable walking shoes

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
